headline: J.D. Vance, Tim Ryan Set to Battle for Ohio Blue-Collar Voters in November
author: Aaron Zitner
sentences: Tuesdays primary elections for a U.S. Senate seat from Ohio reinforced the power that former President Donald Trump holds over the Republican Party and set up a general election contest in which both major candidates are placing a heavy emphasis on blue-collar communities that have largely abandoned the Democratic Party.
Vance, an author and venture capitalist endorsed by Mr. Trump, fended off a crowded field of challengers to win Ohios Republican primary for the Senate, with 32% support in nearly complete results.
Democratic Rep. Tim Ryan, a 10-term House member and 2020 presidential candidate, easily won his partys nomination with nearly 70% of the vote.
